title: Java Game Design
text: Introduction to game development and object-oriented programming with Java.
short: Learn Java through games and animations.
long: Our innovative approach to Java programming uses graphics and animations to visualize computer science concepts. This is the official curriculum for the open-source APCS graphics library that makes the introduction to programming an exciting and creative endeavor for our students.

eclipse.title: Set up Eclipse
eclipse.text: Instructions for setting up Eclipse and APCS graphics on your computer.

calling-methods.title: Calling methods
calling-methods.text: Computer instructions can be grouped together into methods for organization and reusability.

drawing.title: Drawing
drawing.text: Create a Java application to draw on the window with the mouse and keyboard.

branching.title: Branching
branching.text: Control instruction ordering with if, else if and else statements.

control-flow.title: Control Flow
control-flow.text: Use if, else if, and else statements to control the execution of instructions.

variables.title: Variables
variables.text: Store and manipulate information in the computer's memory.

physics.title: Physics
physics.text: Simulate objects moving according to the laws of physics.

logic.title: Logic
logic.text: Learn how to phrase complex statements as a combination of simpler ones.

flappy-bird.title: Flappy Bird
flappy-bird.text: Create your own rendition of this iconic game.
